rules.natural: Whenever paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1, journal1 performs initial screening on paper1.
Under the condition that journal1 performs initial screening on paper1, if the situation where paper1 has data does not entail that paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.
Whenever journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1, then if paper1 needs major revision, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
If the author of paper1 makes an appeal, then the appeal for paper1 is successful.
Either the author of paper1 makes an appeal or journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1.
Whenever journal1 makes a rejection decision on paper1, then if journal1 makes a final decision on paper1, the appeal for paper1 does not succeed.
If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 needs major revision.
Provided that paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 is accepted.
If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 has data.
Either paper1 is reviewed or paper1 is not published.
Either paper1 is revised, or if paper1 is reviewed then it is not accepted.
If paper1 meets standards, then paper1 is not accepted.
If journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor, then paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1.
Either journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor or journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer.
Whenever journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer, then if the implication that paper1 has data entails meeting standards fails, paper1 gets rejection.
Under the condition that paper1 having data does not necessitate meeting standards, it is not the case that paper1 gets rejection.
If journal1 does not make a rejection decision on paper1, then journal1 makes an acceptance decision on paper1.
Provided that conference1 does not have a submission deadline, paper1 is published.

facts.natural: Journal1 makes a final decision on paper1.
Journal1 does not make an acceptance decision on paper1.

steps.natural: Whenever paper1 is reviewed, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
Paper1 is not reviewed.
It is not the case that paper1 is published.
Conference1 has a submission deadline.
Provided that paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1, if it is not the case that paper1 has data implies paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.
Under the condition that journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor, if the lack of data for paper1 leads to meeting standards, then paper1 gets rejection.
If it is not true that paper1 has data implies paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.
Provided that paper1 has data, paper1 meets standards.
Under the condition that paper1 is reviewed, paper1 meets standards.
Whenever paper1 is reviewed, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
Paper1 is not reviewed.
It is not the case that paper1 is published.
Conference1 has a submission deadline.

Under the condition that journal1 makes a final decision on paper1, it is not the case that the appeal for paper1 is successful.
The appeal for paper1 is not successful.
The author of paper1 does not make an appeal.
Journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1.
If paper1 needs major revision, then it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
Whenever paper1 is reviewed, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.
Paper1 is not reviewed.
It is not the case that paper1 is published.
Conference1 has a submission deadline.

(A10 → (¬(A6 → A5) → A7)).natural: Provided that paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1, if it is not the case that paper1 has data implies paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.

(A10 → A11).natural: Whenever paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1, journal1 performs initial screening on paper1.

(A11 → (¬(A6 → A5) → A7)).natural: Under the condition that journal1 performs initial screening on paper1, if the situation where paper1 has data does not entail that paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.

(A12 → ¬A3).natural: If paper1 needs major revision, then it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.

(A13 → (A12 → ¬A3)).natural: Whenever journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1, then if paper1 needs major revision, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.

(A14 → A15).natural: If the author of paper1 makes an appeal, then the appeal for paper1 is successful.

(A14 ∨ A13).natural: Either the author of paper1 makes an appeal or journal1 makes an editor recommendation on paper1.

(A16 → ¬A15).natural: Under the condition that journal1 makes a final decision on paper1, it is not the case that the appeal for paper1 is successful.

(A17 → (A16 → ¬A15)).natural: Whenever journal1 makes a rejection decision on paper1, then if journal1 makes a final decision on paper1, the appeal for paper1 does not succeed.

(A2 → A12).natural: If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 needs major revision.

(A2 → A3).natural: Provided that paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 is accepted.

(A2 → A5).natural: Under the condition that paper1 is reviewed, paper1 meets standards.

(A2 → A6).natural: If paper1 is reviewed, then paper1 has data.

(A2 → ¬A3).natural: Whenever paper1 is reviewed, it is not the case that paper1 is accepted.

(A2 ∨ ¬A1).natural: Either paper1 is reviewed or paper1 is not published.

(A4 ∨ (A2 → ¬A3)).natural: Either paper1 is revised, or if paper1 is reviewed then it is not accepted.

(A5 → ¬A3).natural: If paper1 meets standards, then paper1 is not accepted.

(A6 → A5).natural: Provided that paper1 has data, paper1 meets standards.

(A8 → (¬(A6 → A5) → A7)).natural: Under the condition that journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor, if the lack of data for paper1 leads to meeting standards, then paper1 gets rejection.

(A8 → A10).natural: If journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor, then paper1 undergoes the first round at journal1.

(A8 ∨ A9).natural: Either journal1 is assigned to paper1 by an editor or journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer.

(A9 → (¬(A6 → A5) → A7)).natural: Whenever journal1 is assigned to paper1 by a reviewer, then if the implication that paper1 has data entails meeting standards fails, paper1 gets rejection.

(¬(A6 → A5) → A7).natural: If it is not true that paper1 has data implies paper1 meets standards, then paper1 gets rejection.

(¬(A6 → A5) → ¬A7).natural: Under the condition that paper1 having data does not necessitate meeting standards, it is not the case that paper1 gets rejection.

(¬A17 → A18).natural: If journal1 does not make a rejection decision on paper1, then journal1 makes an acceptance decision on paper1.

(¬G → A1).natural: Provided that conference1 does not have a submission deadline, paper1 is published.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that paper1 is published.

¬A14.natural: The author of paper1 does not make an appeal.

¬A15.natural: The appeal for paper1 is not successful.

¬A18.natural: Journal1 does not make an acceptance decision on paper1.
